children.name: refresh
children.description: Fires when widget refreshes

children.name: change
Example - hook up to the change event

children.description: Fires when the widget page is changed.

children.name: changing
children.description: Fires before the widget page is changed. The change can be prevented by calling the `preventDefault` method of the event parameter, in which case the widget will snap back to the current page.

children.name: value
children.description: Works in data-bound mode only. If a parameter is passed, the widget scrolls to the given dataItem. If not, the method return currently displayed dataItem.

children.name: setDataSource
children.description: Sets the DataSource of an existing ScrollView and rebinds it.

children.name: scrollTo

parameters.name: instant `Boolean` *(default: false)*
parameters.description: If set to true, the ScrollView will jump instantly to the given page without any animation effects.

children.description: Scroll to the given page. Pages are zero-based indexed.

children.name: refresh
children.description: Redraw the mobile ScrollView pager. Called automatically on device orientation change event.

children.name: prev
children.description: Switches to the previous page with animation.

children.name: next
children.description: Switches to the next page with animation.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **ScrollView** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the ScrollView element from DOM.

children.name: content
Example - change widget's content after initialization

children.description: Update the ScrollView HTML content.> **Important:** This method is **not** supported in data bound mode.

children.name: velocityThreshold
children.description: The velocity threshold after which a swipe will navigate to the next page (as opposed to snapping back to the current page).

children.name: template
Example: multiple items template (data is accessed via `data[index].fieldName`)

children.description: The template which is used to render the content of pages. By default the ScrollView renders a div element for every page.**Applicable only in data bound mode.**

children.name: pageSize
children.description: Multiplier applied to the snap amount of the ScrollView. By default, the widget scrolls to the next screen when swipe. If the `pageSize` property is set to `0.5`, the ScrollView will scroll by half of the widget width.**Not applicable in data bound mode.**

children.name: page
children.description: The initial page to display.>If the widget is bound to a DataSource, the initial item to display must be within the records from the first data page. For example if the DataSource has `pageSize: 32` the page configuration option of the ScrollView should not exceed 30.

children.name: itemsPerPage
children.description: Determines how many data items will be passed to the page template.> **Important:** In order ensure smooth scrolling the **pageSize of the DataSource should be 6 times itemsPerPage amount** or higher. For example, if `itemsPerPage` is set to 4, then the `pageSize` must be 24 (4*6) or higher.**Applicable only in data bound mode.**

children.name: enablePager
Example - turn off pager (ScrollView in data bound mode)

children.description: If set to `true` the ScrollView will display a pager. By default pager is enabled.> **Important:** In case the total amount of displayed data is large, it is recommended to turn off the pager by setting `enablePager: false` in the configuration options or via `data-enable-pager="false"` data attribute.

children.name: emptyTemplate
children.description: The template which is used to render the pages without content. By default the ScrollView renders a blank page.**Applicable only in data bound mode.**

children.name: duration
Example - increase the duration of snap transtion

children.description: The milliseconds that take the ScrollView to snap to the current page after released.

children.name: dataSource
Example - ScrollView bound to remote DataSource

children.description: Instance of DataSource that the mobile ScrollView will be bound to. *If DataSource is set, the widget will operate in data bound mode.*> **Important:** In case the total amount of displayed data is large, it is recommended to turn off the pager by setting `enablePager: false` in the configuration options or via `data-enable-pager="false"` data attribute.

children.name: contentHeight
children.description: The height of the ScrollView content. Supports `100%` if the ScrollView is embedded in a stretched view and the ScrollView element **is an immediate child** of the view element.

children.name: bounceVelocityThreshold
children.description: The velocity threshold after which a swipe will result in a bounce effect.

children.name: autoBind
children.description: If set to `false` the widget will not bind to the DataSource during initialization. In this case data binding will occur when the change event of the data source is fired. By default the widget will bind to the DataSource specified in the configuration.**Applicable only in data bound mode.**
